All ROTC Cadets
Second Lieutenants
After Graduation
All students who complete four
years in the ROTC this year will
be commisioned second lieutenants, said Lt. Colonel Emerson F.
Hurley of the Hopkins. ROTC last
week, discounting recent rumors
to the contrary.
In addition, only 46 percent of
the nation's 14,700 ROTC graduates this year will be sent into
service during the year following their graduation. The rest
will be sent in their second year.
Graduates from the ROTC this
year will be given their choice
of when during the twenty-four
months after graduation they wish
to be given active duty. This will
enable a graduate vfho wishes to
start work before 'spending his
two years in the service to become
established in his job.
Other graduates, however, who
wish to get through with their
service as quickly as possible can
do so by going'into_. active service
immediately after graduation.

ankle injury, led the Jays to a
85-77
victory. The Teachers,
playing more football than basketball, hounded Bilgrav's reserves all over the court to cut a
27-point halftime Jay lead to just
seven markers with 15 seconds to
go.
Starting Lineup
In the first 2 minutes, the JHU
starting lineup of Jay Yakubisin,
center; Taylor and John Newton,
forwards; and Bill Civiletti and
Ed Haberman, guards, scored
against zone defense almost at
will, racking up a 50-23 halftime
margin. Taylor, who ended the
game with 28 points, picked up 19
of them in the first two stanzas.

whose hustle and drive got him a
game total of 17 markers; Yakubisin, Who hit from the pivot for

game. Moreover, the Teachers,
lacking the height to play out of
a pivot, began to hit from the
outside, something they had been
unable to do in the opening half.
Ted Venetoulis and Bill Binder,
two set-shooting guards; and
Reece Livingston, Andy Smutny,
and Duke Karwacki, a trio of
driving, ball-stealing forwards,
found the range and the Blue Jay
lead began to melt.

72-61, Bilgrav rushed the first
team back in. But the. tired-up
Teachers continued to make things
difficult and closed the lead to
seven markers, at which point
time ran out on the visitors.
Bilgrav, looking ahead to the
January 19 fray with Towson,
commented, "When a team gets
fired up like that, it's hard to
stop them. I waited almost too
long to put the first team back in.
They'll be rough next week—ail
fired up for us."

corner-man Taylor. He also expressed pleasure over the secondhalf hustle of Rowland King, who

total playing time of about 10
minutes.
